snippet.textDisplay: I'm going to have to disagree about Earthbound Zero being the weakest in the series. It may have been incredibly difficult, but it had a sort of simplistic, yet mystical feeling to it that was missing from the later two Mother games. This game has it's own, unique kind of charm.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm going to have to disagree about Earthbound Zero being the weakest in the series. It may have been incredibly difficult, but it had a sort of simplistic, yet mystical feeling to it that was missing from the later two Mother games. This game has it's own, unique kind of charm.

snippet.textDisplay: Also known as Earthbound Zero. It's easily my least favorite of the series but it still holds a special place. I loved Earthbound so much back when it released, I'll always remember the day I learned there was actually a prequel and I could play it with what was still a novelty: an emulator. The game kicked my butt with its difficulty but I still managed to finish it. It also felt nice to recognize some things from the second game, like some songs etc.
snippet.textOriginal: Also known as Earthbound Zero. It's easily my least favorite of the series but it still holds a special place. I loved Earthbound so much back when it released, I'll always remember the day I learned there was actually a prequel and I could play it with what was still a novelty: an emulator. The game kicked my butt with its difficulty but I still managed to finish it. It also felt nice to recognize some things from the second game, like some songs etc.
